subject: Public Speaking
title: Boudicca's Charge Against Rome
description: Learn Boudicca's Charge Against Rome in one minute.

hook.text: In 60 CE, a British queen stood before 100,000 warriors and told them to destroy the Roman occupation.

buildup.text: Boudicca had been publicly flogged and her daughters assaulted by Roman soldiers. Her rage was personal.

discovery.text: She reportedly said she fought not as a queen but as an ordinary woman defending her freedom and body.

twist.text: Her army burned London to the ground. Archaeologists still find a layer of ash from her revolt.

climax.text: Rome eventually crushed the rebellion, but Boudicca proved that a personal grievance can mobilize a nation.

punchline.text: Her fury burned so hot, you can still find the ashes.

quiz.question: What motivated Boudicca's revolt against Rome?
options: Personal assault and public humiliation by Roman soldiers
